## Functions

### parseAssignmentExpression() {#a71d0c2aeb5e324a4a962bcfa85617f2c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::MCParserUtils::parseAssignmentExpression (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Name, bool allow_redef, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcasmparser">MCAsmParser</a> &amp; Parser, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcsymbol">MCSymbol</a> &#42;&amp; Symbol, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcexpr">MCExpr</a> &#42;&amp; Value)</>}>
Parse a value expression and return whether it can be assigned to a symbol with the given name.

On success, returns false and sets the Symbol and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> output parameters.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/lib/mc/mcparser/asmparser-cpp/#l06424">6424</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/mc/lib/mc/mcparser/asmparser-cpp">AsmParser.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
